categoryRubrics.rule: All Template Ids should be correct
Generally, the identifiers found within a CDA document should be unique and non-reoccurring within the same document.
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient.
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
Medications coded with RxNorm SCD, SBD, GPCK, or BPCPK codes
Immunizations should be represented in the appropriate section.
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient.
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
Smoking status code value should be valid
Smoking status observation Template Id should be valid
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient.
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
Immunizations coded with CVX codes
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient.
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient.
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
Lab Result values should use preferred UCUM units

issuesList.xmlString:
<observation xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" classCode="OBS" moodCode="EVN">
                  
                  <templateId extension="2015-08-01" root="2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.2"/>
                  <templateId root="2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.2"/>
                  <id root="f1aa44dd-6f39-4f5c-b267-123c3824b571"/>
                  <code code="5797-6" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.1" codeSystemName="LOINC" displayName="Ketones [Mass/Volume] in urine by test strip"/>
                  <text>
                    <reference value="#result7"/>
                  </text>
                  <statusCode code="completed"/>
                  <effectiveTime value="20150622"/>
                                   
                  
                  <value code="260385009" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" codeSystemName="SNOMED-CT" displayName="Negative" xsi:type="CO"/>
                  
                  <interpretationCode code="N" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.5.83"/>
                  <referenceRange>
                    <observationRange>
                      <value code="260385009" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" codeSystemName="SNOMED-CT" displayName="Negative" xsi:type="CO"/>
                    </observationRange>
                  </referenceRange>                 
                </observation>

categoryRubrics.description: Lab Results should use the top 2000 LOINC codes and their corresponding units as a best practice.

categoryRubrics.rule: Lab results should be expressed with LOINC codes
The EffectiveDate/Time elements for the Result Organizer must encompass the underlying observations.
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient.
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
The Vital Sign Observation entries should use LOINC codes to represent the type of vital sign being captured

issuesList.xmlString: <code xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="59408-5" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.1" codeSystemName="LOINC" displayName="OXYGEN SATURATION IN ARTERIAL BLOOD BY PULSE OXIMETRY"/>

categoryRubrics.description: Each of the vital sign observation present in the document should use the recommended LOINC codes to represent the vital sign.

categoryRubrics.rule: Each of the Vital Sign Observations should use the recommended UCUM units to represent the vital sign measurement result
The EffectiveDate/Time elements for the Vital Sign Organizer must encompass the underlying observations.
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient.
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: All problem codes are should express with core subset of SNOMED codes
Problem Concern effective times reflect the appropriate problem concern status.
The EffectiveDate/Time elements for the Problem Concern Act must encompass the underlying observations.
Problem Concern status and Problem Observation status are consistent with each other.
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient.
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
Allergies observation effective should align with Allergies concern act effective time
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

Patient DOB should be valid and properly precisioned
